clinical_study.brief_title: Dermal Suturing Only Versus Layered Cutaneous Closure
clinical_study.official_title: Dermal Suturing Only Versus Layered Cutaneous Closure: A Randomized Split Wound Comparative Effectiveness Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether a single layer dermally sutured wound results in superior outcomes to a layered closure.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether a single layer dermally sutured wound results in superior outcomes to a layered closure. Our aims are to compare outcomes using a split wound model, where half the wound is sutured with one technique and the other half is sutured with the other. This will be measured via the physician observer scar assessment scale, a validated scar instrument and via wound width. Our hypothesis is that wounds with a single layer closure will result in cosmetically superior wound outcomes.

primary_outcome.measure: Assessment of Scar on the Patient and Observer Scar Assessment Scale at 3 Months
primary_outcome.description: After surgical procedure, half of the subject's wound will be closed by single layer suturing, while the other half is closed by layered cutaneous closure. After 3 months, subjects will return to clinic for evaluation of the cosmesis of both types of closure techniques.

primary_outcome.measure: Assessment of Scar on the Patient and Observer Scar Assessment Scale at 12 Months
primary_outcome.description: After surgical procedure, half of the subject's wound will be closed by single layer suturing, while the other half is closed by layered cutaneous closure. After 12 months, subjects will return to clinic for evaluation of the cosmesis of both types of closure techniques.

secondary_outcome.description: The width of the scar will be measured 1 centimeter from the midline on both sides. There is no defined width that is considered satisfactory or not satisfactory. The measurements will be compared between subjects.
Noting the presence or absence of bleeding, dehiscence, infection or spitting sutures.

arm_group.description: The side assigned to dermal suturing only will be closed with a single layer of deep absorbable sutures. The method will be buried vertical mattress or set-back suturing at the surgeons discretion.
The side assigned to layered closure is closed with 5-0 fast acting gut.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Able to give informed consent themselves
- Patient scheduled for cutaneous surgical procedure with predicted linear closure
- Willing to return for follow up visits
Exclusion Criteria:
- Mentally handicapped
- Incarceration
- Pregnant Women
- Wounds with predicted closure length less than 3 cm
- Wounds unable to be fully closed via primary closure
